text: Livingston is a rude unprofessional dentist.

name: Leila Campbell
text: Don't come to this place. It's expensive and the people that work st the Prattville al office are very rude and unprofessional

name: snow lily
text: I called to make an appointment. The woman said it’s very expensive and it will cost 150.00 just to get through the door. They need a new person that doesn’t talk down to people and tries to talk them out of coming in. Now I am going to talk to the doctor that referred me to them. If they treat you that way on the phone, I can only imagine how they treat you inside. Pity, the doctor came highly recommended but I’m not going to be talked to like that.

name: Mohammad Alam
text: From check in to check out, one word... EXCEPTIONAL! Would highly recommend it! Thank you Dr Johnson and the entire team!

name: Julie Jones
text: Dr . Kean and his staff are awesome in my book. They were very courteous, efficient, friendly . No long waiting . In and out . I would highly recommend Dr. Kean and his staff . This is day 3 after surgery and Im healing well . Thank you!!

name: ashli nico
text: Dr. Johnson did a WONDERFUL job. I had 4 wisdom teeth removed, and after I wore off the medicine you would never guess I just had 4 teeth cut out! Even in the back where he cut them out you can't tell. The staff was also AMAZING and VERY nice! Nothing less than 5 stars!

name: Danetonio Riley
text: Set consultation 3 months out then quote 2300 to remove 3 wisdom tooth..... highly upset

name: tina knox
text: Our experience was great. I took my 15 yr old granddaughter to have her 4 wisdom teeth pulled all at one time. I was a little nervous about this but she wasn't. And with good reason. The staff and Dr Johnson was great. They explained everything very well. We went on a Tues for the exam and on Friday her teeth was out. It took about 15 min. She had iv for pain and only had a slight ache afterwards which we were given pain meds just in case. She only used about 3 or 4. Our experience was a good one and I would recommend them to anyone looking to have oral surgery.

name: J T
text: What a bunch of jerks!  I can’t get an appointment because I’m not in their system anymore-even though I have seen Dr Johnson before!  So they want me to find a dentist to refer me again.  Really?  After explaining I had been getting my teeth removed in Ga at an oral surgeon in Columbus.  IDIOTS!  I hate IDIOT schedulers!  I went to school a lot more longer than that little girl did to be treated rudely.

name: Ruth Kempel
text: Dr. Bondurant and staff were pleasant and professional. My tooth extraction was totally painless thanks to the doctor's expert administration of anesthesia. There were no after effects from meds and healing was quick. I'd highly recommend this oral surgeon!

name: Jordan Rhodes
text: If you want to be treated very poorly and have an extremely bad or unpleasant experience then Dr. Bondurant is your man. It is absolutely despicable how badly we were treated. My spouse was recommended to see him with a serious fracture on both sides of his jaw. We went to the appointment and he seemed happy to help, and even set a surgery date and time. We receive a call from him a few days before the scheduled surgery to hear him say “he can’t do it”. Excuse me? Your a doctor? And you practice medicine? But, yet you have a patient that is in terrible condition then ensure them and the family that you will take care of them, but apparently never even looked at the CT Scan to examine the injury well enough that you have to call them days later to inform them that you incapable of performing the surgery. How sad, disappointing and unprofessional. I would expect MUCH more from a doctor that’s been practicing for so long.

name: Colton Mosley
text: I had wisdom teeth pulled, didn’t feel any pain. Great recovery post-surgery. Highly recommend Dr. Bondurant!

name: paul williams
text: Best dentist ever...

name: Marcus Agnew
text: 10 STARS BECAUSE 5 ISNT ENOUGH TO RATE THIS PLACE. STAFF IS VERY NICE AND PROFESSIONAL! WELL WORTH THE DRIVE FROM MOBILE! HE IS HONEST AND UP FRONT. YOU CANT ASK FOR A BETTER ORAL SURGEON.

name: Susan Trimble
text: I had a tooth pulled and it went flawlessly.  I highly recommend Dr. Bondurant.  He is very professional.  His staff is excellent.  I have had virtually no pain and a very quick recovery.

name: Maggie Champion
text: Dr. Bondurant is the best oral surgeon I have ever met. He is a Medical Doctor and also is an oral surgeon. He is personable and professional and I highly recommend him. You will not be sorry !

name: Jan Jenkins
text: Dr Bondurant is one of a kind!!! I have been very happy with Dr Bondurant and his staff, they are extremely considerate to your comfort while they are working on your mouth. The staff is very friendly  and proficient at their job. I am so happy to have such an excellent  Oral Surgeron in our area.

name: Jaime Atine
text: Doc may be good but very rude. Some of the staff r just as rude. Above all they r an okay service.

name: super night
text: This place is awesome help me out a lot thanks. the Margaritas are so good

name: Jerome Williams
text: Got a tooth pull didn't feel a thing

name: Lauren Abbott
text: I had my consult yesterday and surgery today and everything went great. Dr. Evans, anesthesia, dental assistant, and post op nurses were all wonderful. I was there less than 2 hours for my procedure. Definitely a 5 star facility.

name: Bernyce Wilmot
text: I am extremely nervous when it comes to going to the dentist. My first appointment with Dr Evans was phenomenal, I was at ease and calm. He is very friendly and explains everything that  is going to happen. His nurse Christy is also very friendly and makes you feel like family. I had 3 teeth extracted today and like the first visit I felt comfortable and no anxiety.  In the recovery center the nurse was very attentive and caring. I highly recommend Dr Evans and his staff

name: Shirley Kilpatrick
text: My first visit to this office and it was great everyone was so friendly made you feel right at home like you were apart of the family couldn't ask for nicer people if you need oral surgery done this office is the one you want.

name: Steve Shertzer
text: The doctor and staff did an excellent job and were very friendly. My three tooth extraction went very well - and was painless. Thank you Dr Evans and crew

name: Wendy Silavent
text: My son had seven teeth pulled. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I will tell everyone to go there to get any dental work done.

name: Talia Mills
text:
Dr Evans is one of the best doctors in Alabama.
The kindest most professional man I have ever used. I 💯 trust him with my face and my teeth. He has a wide variety of services he provides in his office.
Dr falconer and Dr Bess are just as wonderful!!! I recommend them 10000xx!
Talia Mills

name: Sherry Glass
text: I seen Dr. Falconer for a consultation and everyone that I encountered was exceptionally nice and concerned in making this experience as pleasant as possible. I have a blood clotting autoimmune disorder and am very nervous about having 6 teeth extracted but they put me at ease. While I'm not looking forward to having it done I appreciate the kindness that the staff shows.

name: Sandra Warren
text:
First, I do not do well at dentist office... but this was for consultation only today, but still apprehensive about what I would hear.  The receptionist was very kind even though she was very busy.  I did not get the two assistances names but they were both very kind and informative !  Dr Evans reviewed my x-rays with me; answering all my many questions, as we talked....VERY knowledgeable, patient and kind!!  Although, I did not schedule today, I will see him soon for my oral surgery. The insurance lady was not able to give me specific total cost because I did not schedule my surgery today, but was very informative and kind enough to give me what it would cost someone with no dental insurance and  advised me to check my policy for specific details.
To Dr. Evans and all his staff  THANK YOU!

name: Alan Rogers
text: Dr. Falconer was very friendly and put every thing in terms that was easily understandable,  When I went to get the teeth removed everyone in the office was very accommodating and friendly, I was taken care of very well after being put out for tooth extractions and then being woke back up and making sure I was coherent to where I was and able to walk to car where my wife was waiting to take me home. I  recommend Southeastern  Oral Surgery to everyone  needing work on your teeth!

name: Tenay Reeves
text: This is a great dental office. The staff is very nice and helpful. The doctor is a kind, nice and down to earth physician. I would definitely recommend your all to anyone who is looking for oral surgeon.

name: Daneisia Davis
text: The staff there is so great. I got three wisdom teeth pulled and was well informed and taken care of all the way to my wife car.  My doctor was Dr.Evan , once I was put under its like I woke up in a chair preparing to get released.  It was mind blowing.  It was a really great experience.  If you need your teeth pulled this is 100% the place to go.  I’m making this post and I literally just got my teeth pulled a hour and a half ago. Everything might be a little woozy that first hour but I did pretty good.  I would recommend any and everyone ! Thanks everyone for your services today !

name: Edwana “Nicki” Thompson
text: I highly recommend Southeastern Oral Maxillofacial to anyone needing any type of oral surgery. They were very pleasant and professional. I was extremely nervous as I have never been sedated before, but they took very good care of me. Dr. Falconer is awesome.

name: Natalie Joiner
text: I was referred to this office by my pharmacy manager. I originally saw Dr Falconer. He was very nice. I did have to move my surgery up due to pain and saw Dr Evans. Everyone up front and in recovery were awesome. I have a special shout out to my nurse and anesthesiologist. I was very nervous and they were very calming and caring. I had 4 teeth removed with 1 of them being a wisdom tooth. I highly recommend this office. They were awesome from start to finish.

name: Linda Garner
text:
My oral surgery was painless and Dr. Evans was wonderful.  Everything was very professional and caring.

Thank you for a great dental experience.

,

name: KevinMcPCFII
text: I was able to get in to see a doctor quickly. Doctor Falconer is friendly and attentive. He spent time explaining the process. He did not try to hurry out of the office. The staff assisting the doctors is great. Everyone is friendly and kind. I’m thankful to have this resolved. I highly recommend Southeastern Oral to anyone needing dental care.

name: Benita Smith
text: I am so thankful for each and everyone that works here! I felt welcomed from the very moment we walked in. I was very nervous, but my nurse and anesthesiologist made me feel comfortable and relaxed! From walking and to leaving out, I was well taken care of! I recommend them to everyone! Thanks for being such an outstanding place...God bless y’all

name: Diane cullinan
text: I had my consultation with Dr. Evans on scheduling my upcoming extraction. He was very thorough and friendly. Also the entire staff was friendly and welcoming.

name: Trudy Wright
text:
I highly recommend Southeastern Oral-Maxillofacial & Cosmetic Surgery Center, P.C. of Dothan, AL. I’ve been fortunate enough to have the Oral and Maxiofillial surgeons of this group care for my oral surgery needs for many, many years and I have yet to have anything but excellent experiences.
Dr. Davis is now retired but while he was practicing he performed oral surgery and placed several implants for me over a period of years. Drs. Davis and Bess, in consultation with my dentist Dr. Dollar, also surgically moved my jaw forward correcting my bite and very successfully relieved the jaw pain and headaches the misalignment had caused.
In the last several years Dr. Falconer has placed five implants for me and I have found him to be as personable, kind and caring a professional as was Dr. Davis.
I also want to commend the excellent staff who keep this very busy office running so smoothly. Each of them is pleasant and eager to assist the patients and their family whether in person or by telephone.
Last but certainly not least, I cannot say enough positive things about Ms. Shelley, the implant co-ordinator for this practice. Over the the last few years Ms. Shelley has worked with me tirelessly, helping me with scheduling, sometimes rescheduling appointments, solving co-ordination and communication problems with a “former, less than cooperative” dentist’s office I switched to when we moved away from the area, and keeping me knowledgable enough to make intelligent financial decisions about lost teeth. This young woman is very kind and caring, always pleasant and helpful and such a nice person!
We drive two hours each way to be able to use this surgery group and I consider it worth every mile we travel which should tell you how highly I recommend them.

name: Tara Waddell
text: You couldn't tell my daughter had two teeth surgically removed if you hadn't known. They did a fantastic job! & there really wasn't no swelling, and she hasn't really complained about pain. I don't know what their secret is, but my 6 year old had an amazing experience & I couldn't be more enthused with the outcome.

name: Charmayne Sanders
text: They made me feel very comfortable and talked to me and not at me

name: AMANDA CAUSEY
text: Let me say the hospitality in this place is not but amazing. From the front door to the back. Shout out to Ms Sherry she's awesome!!! I went to have a tooth removed and I felt at home.❤️

name: Rick J
text: I’ve had two implants done here and both times I felt the entire staff did a wonderful job. Very friendly and very helpful; made me feel as though I was the most important patient. Highly recommend and if I ever need another implant I know exactly where to go. I thank you all.

name: Mike Tidbit
text: They work miracles there! Great experience.

name: Nighta

name: Paula Givens

The clinical staff made me feel comfortable and welcome. If I ever need treatment in the future, I will definitely visit SOS again!

resp.text: Ultimate, we would love an opportunity to discuss this situation but would need more information. If you are approved on your girl friend’s HIPAA, please give us a call if you would like to talk further. Cindy Austin, Administrator 334-792-2880. Otherwise, she can call us. Thank you.

name: Samantha Jacobs
text: Staff is very professional and polite. The wait time is very short. Proper social distancing in regards to waiting area. They get you in get you fixed up and get you out. They actually got me over my fear of dentist!!! Would definitely recommend over and over again!!!

name: Amy Piggott
text: My daughter who is eleven had a wisdom tooth removed this morning. Although she was both nervous and afraid, the staff was warm and friendly which comforted her and, in turn, also comforted me. Thanks to all of the staff who made this frightful experience more pleasant and positive.

name: Cheryl Kelly
text: Even during these trying and difficult times of the pandemic ,everyone I met here was polite and professional. Friendly and caring staff .

name: Leslie Pelham
text: These guys did a fabulous job of making me comfortable, answering my questions, and fixing my problem. They were polite, knowledgeable, and very professional. I would recommend them to anyone needing or wanting quality oral care. Thanks guys.

text: All points of contacts here were friendly and courteous. Nice office area that was clean. But our check-in lady was a Gator fan (barf). Y’all gone have to fix that. #GoNoles

name: Jacob Lawrence
text: I had all 4 wisdom teeth removed. Frankly, I was quite scared but the staff was very friendly and assured me that they would take good care of me. Post surgery has gone pretty well so far. Thanks to dr falconer and staff for doing a great job

name: Michelle Simmons
text: My visit today was great.  The staff was very nice, helpful and made me feel welcome. Dr. Falconer was thorough in explaining the procedure for removing my broken tooth.  I would definitely recommend this practice!!!

name: Krystal Barrett
text: My first visit was Thursday to have 4 teeth surgically removed. I was nervous but Dr. Falconer was so nice and informative on what was going to be done, answered all my questions, and helped ease my nerves. His staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Highly recommened them!!

name: Beverly Daniels
text: Very high quality professional service with the friendliest staff around. I hate any dentist and they set me at ease before, during and after my procedure. Highly recommend them.

name: Wailana Diaz
text: The staff there is very friendly no complaints here. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone I know hands down. Thank you thank you thank you! 😁

name: Niga Thomas
text: My appointment was at 11:15 am, I got there at 11:00 am . I didn’t get called back until 1:30 p.m. They apologized nonchalantly. I was very upset about the long wait time... I was there for Wisdom Teeth removal, So my husband had to drive me and stay during the procedure until it was over to drive us home. We had to get a babysitter for our three kids, so we could attend this appointment. The two hour wait time resulted an extra 100 dollars to our babysitter. If this staff would have told us about the longer wait time or the actual time I would have been seen . There would have been no issues. The Dr and Staff was wonderful and thorough. Just wished their time management was better . If I would have showed up 2 hrs late I bet the appointment would have been canceled.The only reason I am giving this service a 2 star is because at least the staff was nice. I hope this helps for future patients!

name: Ashley Mckeel
text: Had a tooth extraction and the experience couldn't of went any better. I literally didn't have an ounce of pain. The doctors & staff are amazing.

name: Paula Anderson-ard
text: I absolutely love this place!! The entire staff was so friendly and helpful in every way. I would highly recommend this location to anyone who needs to see an oral surgeon. I didn't even have a long wait time to be seen!

name: Katelynn Smith
text:
Editing to say that the office administrator contacted me to apologize and correct this error:
They got me in, did the surgery, and I was on my way. The reason I am giving such a low star rating is they failed to tell me that if I waited 15 days my dental insurance would cover it. They told me initially they accepted my insurance but not one person in the office felt it right to inform me that if I waited 2 weeks I wouldn't have to pay $1500 out of pocket.
So thanks

text: Today was my first visit and I absolutely loved this office. The staff was nice and very helpful and Dr. Evans’ bedside manner far exceeded my expectations. I was in and out quickly, too !

resp.text: Tena, Please contact our office to further discuss your experience as we are unable to locate any interaction between you and our office.  We would love the opportunity to correct any misunderstanding. You may ask for our Front Desk Supervisor.  Thank you.

text: Awesome service...

name: Mel T
text: Wonderful!

name: Mary Humphrey
text: I loved it!!!!

name: Michele Mills
text: If I could post zero stars I would. The dr is nice enough, BUT I was told to pay 225 $ for a scan of my mouth and that they will file insurance AFTER the fact but just in case ins does not pay that I had to prepay. It has been a month and they have not filed any claims and what makes matters worse is that I was told that this surgeon would be able to treat my facial tmj trauma but he instead referred me to a dr who does not file ANY insurance with ANY company whatsoever and is basically cosmetic. Had I been able to talk to the dr prior to PAYING out of POCKET for a scan that NOONE would even FILE for me with my INSURANCE then maybe I would have known that he would not be able to treat me. ALSO why couldn't he treat this? THIS IS HIS SPECIALTY!? The office staff is TERRIBLE! I have called repeatedly and been told that it has been filed and I can see online it has not plus I have called and nothing has been submitted. I have faxed and mailed paperwork with my portion of the claim filled out and all it needs is the dr portion filled out by their billing staff and again that has gotten me nowhere. My insurance covers office consults 100% and TMJ 100%. x-ray radiology 100%. They said this would not be covered and (office staff) and that is FINE but they can have the curtesy to FILE it like they SAID THEY WOULD! DO NOT USE THIS DR IF IT IS FOR TMJ OR IF THEY TELL YOU TO PAY ANYTHING OUT OF POCKET- REFUSE !

name: Michele Mills
text: UPDATE: have made no progress with this. Have called the office and still received no help. Was told that the person who files insurance will call me back and she has not. If the insurance denied the claim I would be perfectly ok with that but to be told to prepay and told that the office WILL file is being LIED to.

name: kevin harwell
text: I was referred, by my regular DDS, to an Oral Surgeon to extract an infected molar which could not be numbed properly. The referral Surgeon would not treat my tooth because of my high blood pressure at that time. He sent me away in pain to get my HBP corrected by my Dr. and told me to call back in a couple weeks. I saw my HPB Dr. and he adjusted my meds and everything was back to normal, in days. I was in agony and needed treatment ASAP.  I called the Oral Surgeon's office and was still put off for at least 2 weeks. I called Dr. Kamelchuk's office the same day and his staff got me in immediately knowing my obvious discomfort. My DDS sent a referral and I was quickly treated, my pain gone, cured. Dr. Kamelchuk's staff of professionals are the most compassionate, caring, dedicated, cordial, health care folks I have ever had the pleasure to know. Their dedication to medicine and the easing of the concerns of a patient and patient's family are painstakingly put to rest by reassurance. I have been in the Medical/Dental profession for over 40+ years and find this Dr. and staff to be exceptional. My personal thanks to you all.

name: Kaiden Soffes
text: I went in to get my wisdom teeth extracted. I must say, I was very surprised. They treated me with the upmost respect and were very kind to me during the whole process!

name: JD Higdon
text:
Dr. Kamelchuk is the BEST. Hands down, the very best!

I've received excellent care and treatment from Dr. Lee, as well as his entire staff. They're a team, a family if you will... they care for and about people.

I was treated with kindness and respect by Dr. Lee and team from the moment I walked in the door, until my procedures were complete.

The team has gone the extra mile to assure I was properly cared for, even made  courtesy calls to check on my well being afterwards.

Dr. Lee's demeanor is very calming, never rushed or hurried, always has time to answer any an all questions, explains procedures thoroughly from beginning to end.

A very kind, caring, and thoughtful person with an excellent manner.

Thank you!

name: Christel Jones
text: I love this place the staff was awesome and the DR was fantastic he takes the time to explain everything to you and he is so nice it’s really unbelievable until you meet him and his staff all I can say is WOW

name: Kaptev “Kaptev3k” Holmes
text: Omg this place was the best dentist experience I have had in a long time. The took care everything on time and professional.

name: Paul Wilkie
text: I was told that my insurance was NOT covered for this doctor when it IS, the office personnel  went off of the diagnosis of what my PPO wrote on the referral, they gave no thought to make a proper diagnosis and just went off of what the referral said, BUT they were quick to tell me that it would be $190 for a visit and xray. This doctor is nothing short of greedy and a money chaser. Not only would I NOT give them my business, but I am intent on "referring" them to the ADA for malpractice.

name: Michael Smith
text: Excellent shop! Evaluated on Tuesday and implant complete Friday Morning. Professional, fast, friendly. Wish I hadn't needed them, but I'm glad they were there to do it!

name: Travis Love
text: The nurses were very nice and understanding of my condition as I struggle with anxiety. I was terrified to go under anesthesia. Dr. Kamelchuk was very nice and an excellent surgeon. Would definitely recommend this office over others.

name: Frank O
text: Great Doctor! Even walked me out to my Vehicle after Surgery.

name: June Foster
text: The doctor is very business-like and reluctant to answer questions.

name: Star Power
text:
Please be careful with this dentist. I paid what my insurance wouldn’t cover out of pocket before my visit only to be billed for an additional $400. I was billed this because they changed my diagnosis after they said my tooth was impacted and my own dentist said my tooth was impacted. Without the impacted tooth, they were owed more money because of the price breakdown. They also did not consult with my insurance for their estimate so it was way off anyways. My insurance company said they’ve never heard of a dentist that just makes up an estimate without seeing what is covered by insurance first. Which is what this practice did. (My personal dentist always does this first. However l, I was referred to them BECAUSE my tooth was impacted.) I will never use them again and unless you want to come out of pocket $100s of dollars more after your surgery weeks and weeks later…. you shouldn’t either.

P. S. I refuse to say that my care and treatment was not excellent though because despite this I had no complications after my surgery, I felt cared for, AND everyone I have spoken with has been friendly. That is the only reason I could not in good faith give them one star. Because I genuinely feel they did a good job on my teeth and made me feel comfortable while I was there. However, I absolutely did NOT appreciate how they handled my insurance, my estimate, and how they overcharged and changed my diagnosis especially when I know my tooth was ,in fact, impacted because I had multiple opinions from 3 different dentists total.

name: Sinjean Simmons
text: Great experience. I had all four of my wisdom teeth extracted. The office staff were friendly and helpful. As well as the nurses and Dr. Kellam. Very clean office, waiting area and workspace. This is only day 2 of my healing process. They give you step by step instructions to help with the process. So far, I’ve been just fine. I would definitely recommend. :-)

name: Hannah Sjolander
text: Best place hands down when you need a quick wisdom teeth extraction surgery. He didn’t have to miss many days of work with the convenience of doing an online consultation then making the appointment one week later. Healing wonderfully!

name: Adrian Griffin
text: Absolutely love Dr. Kellan and his entire staff!!!! So nice and friendly. Mr. Tony is hilarious. He really helped my daughter to relax.  They explained everything to you. He is the best I've been too.

resp.text: We love you and yes Tony is funny

name: Gesina Kimbrough-Thomas
text: Never have I ever had teeth pulled without fear. This was the most calm, relaxing extraction I’ve ever experienced. Then they call to check on you the next day to make sure you’re good.

name: Terry Hancock
text: Very professional and courteous. They called to check on my son multiple times after his procedure. I would highly recommend them!

name: Kedrick Bettis
text: Staff was very professional and made my experience pain free, I would definitely recommend them for your dental needs!

name: Peter Salvarlis
text: Best oral surgeon out their. The staff is top notch.

name: Erica Porter
text: Dr Kellam was vey nice and explained everything. We felt at ease and the staff is great!

name: Niki Lambert
text:
Both of my kids had their wisdom teeth removed by Dr. Kellam and I’d recommend him to anyone! The staff is so nice and helpful, and they are all so reassuring that everything will be fine.
Dr. Kellam takes time to talk with you and the patient before and after to make sure you leave with all the information needed to heal properly and take care of yourself! He also sees his patients out to their vehicles after the procedure which says a lot about him to me!
We love his practice and if ever needed again we will definitely choose him!

name: Classic Gamer
text: The office was extremely clean, pleasant and inviting. The staff ensured my comfort as I waited by offering me coffee. If I could give ten stars I would for the friendliness of the staff and experience with Dr Kellam. He was so precise and made sure all of my questions were answered. As I walked to the waiting room to wait for my son to have the surgery, I had no doubt as a parent he was in good hands.

name: Jessica Reese
text: Dr. Kellam and his team are true professionals. I went to him for any wisdom teeth removal and my root canal extraction. Each time he and his team made sure I was comfortable and well informed about the procedures. I will be going back for my dental implant and I know they’ll take good care of me. By the way, the have excellent coffee!

name: Abby Walker
text: Dr Kellam, along  with entire staff were amazing.  I went in to have a tooth removed and was quite nervous due to having trigeminal neuralgia in the same side of my face. Dr. Kellam patiently listened to my concerns then thoroughly explained everything.. I HIGHLY recommend Dr. Kellam for all of your oral surgical needs.

resp.text: Well good thing we are close. The feedback is much appreciated. It is always a joy to get to see you!

name: Hugh Praytor
text: Dr. K. Jackson and his staff at Alabama Surgical Arts were very knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful all the way from the consultation to after the surgery. I had 3 wisdom teeth removed. The surgery was successful. My pain level was manageable to minimal in the days following the surgery. I'd say my recovery was remarkable quick and Alabama Surgical Arts exceeded my expectations. The assisted my recovery in providing a list of medications and an antibiotic. They also gave me a form to take home to guide me to the quickest road to recovery. I may have "babied" my mouth  too much after surgery, but I was back to eat whatever I wanted in 9-10 days. I would highly recommend Dr. K. Jackson and his associates at Alabama Surgical Arts to anyone considering getting their wisdom teeth removed in the River Region! Thank you, Alabama Surgical Arts!

resp.text: Thank you for you kind words.

name: Ingrid Muniz
text: The Med Spa has been such a great place to take care of my skincare needs. Over the last few months I have noticed a drastic improvement in my skin and skin tone. They helped with clearing melasma I had around my cheeks allowing my skin to look much more youthful. High recommend their services for skin care needs!

resp.text: Thank you Kelsey does an amazing job with skincare and one of the most integral parts of our team. Happy you had great results!

name: Wanda Williams
text: I stay in Selma and was referred to an oral surgeon and his earliest appointment was two months away. I was in pain and couldn't wait two months. They got me in really quick. On the day of my procedure I had to be sedated. I was in and out of the office in less than an hour. They have friendly, professional staff and a excellent doctor. If you have to go somewhere for an oral surgical procedure, this is the place to go, Thank you all for the excellent experience. I would recommend to anyone but what really impressed me is their diligence in following up. Dr. Jackson called to check and see how was doing later on that night.

resp.text: Thank you Wanda we pride ourselves on being available especially in situations when time is of the essence.

name: Mr and Mrs Loller
text: Intake, handling, and discharge were all fine. Staff shows tremendous interest and care in their patients.  HOWEVER, I told them three times I was allergic to penicillin, yet was prescribed a penicillin antibiotic. Luckily, the staff at Walgreens caught the error and contacted them for a alternate antibiotic script.  Dr Nizam did call that evening to check on me, but I missed the call.

resp.text: Sorry to hear about your inconvenience. Happy we got it handled for you!

name: Ali Meghani
text: I had a very good consultation with Dr Nizam, he explained everything to me in a very detailed fashion and was very honest and helpful with my options

resp.text: Thank you. It was a pleasure getting to meet you!

name: Richard Sky
text: Very nice facility.  Staff both professional and friendly.  Appreciated the focused yet empathetic approach to my problem.  Very impressed with Dr Nizam and his OR nurses.  As a word- and language-freak, I particularly compliment the post-operation written instructions.  And as a retired military, I search for and notice character and work ethic, as well as desired results, and they are all here at Alabama Surgical Arts.

resp.text: Thank you for the impressively written review. All things we strive for!

name: LaBella Renee
text: I should have written this a long time ago. However, I plan on calling in today to schedule an extraction. So, it made me think about the AMAZING service I received with my 1st one. Dr. Nazim is AMAZING.  The front desk, back office staff and everyone there was so inviting. I've ALWAYS had bad experiences getting anything done to my teeth. Which I did explain to them and I was nothing more than pleased. I didn't even swell. I ALWAYS swell. But he did immaculate work.

resp.text: Thank you so much. We look forward to seeing you!

name: Bernard Lowe jr
text:
I can't say enough good things about my experiences with Alabama surgical arts, Dr. Nizam, and all the staff.  I am a veteran and it has been a difficult process getting my procedures approved, but the staff helped walk me through the steps and eventually got my procedures approved.  Dr. Nizam was awesome in discussing my upcoming surgeries and making sure I was comfortable.  Unfortunately, I developed a clot on the site of my surgery on a Friday, AFTER HOURS!  Dr. Nizam and his wife personally treated me, and were extremely pleasant and comforting.

I don't get dental surgery often, but when I do I only want to use Alabama surgical arts and Dr. Nizam!  😁

resp.text: Thanks. It's an honor to get to serve those who have served us!

text:
Very courteous and professional staff. Highly recommended.

name: Tracey Canada
text: Alabama Surgical Arts provides a warm and inviting atmosphere. The facility is beautiful, clean, and very spacious. Each staff member I encountered was equally warm, friendly and engaging. A very professional team. Their customer services is top notch! They provide detailed instructions each and every step of the way. Every question I had was answered with a smile, even behind the masks. 😀. Dr. Sami Nazam, II was a joy to have a Doctor. I was extremely nervous, not knowing who I would be seeing on my first visit, but his aura was kind, caring and confident. Upon reviewing my x-rays he quickly observed a new area of concern, which had not been brought to my attention by the referring physicians, and to their credit, it may not have been noticeable on other visits. However, Dr. Nazam reassured me that he would take care of everything. He and his dental/surgical team all have great bedside manners,. They equally helped to put me at ease with their warm, funny and engaging dialogue. Lastly, Dr. Sami personally contacted me the evenings of each procedure, I was pleasantly shocked and excited to have my him call to inquire how I was doing as the pain was intense. He explained what he saw during the procedures, what was done to resolve the issues, what to expect over the next few days, and how to address any concerns I may further encounter.  Wow!!!  His follow-up actions spoke volumes to me, VOLUMES...! 🙏🏽👏🏽🙏🏽   Thank you for making me feel like a part of your family. Awesome, awesome job Dr. Nazam, and the Alabama Surgical Arts staff. 😀😀😀

resp.text: Thank you so much! It means the world to us.

name: Faith Hurst
text: I was very nervous about getting my wisdom teeth out, but the entire staff was very kind and didn’t hesitate to joke and laugh with me to ease my nerves. They answered all of my questions patiently and in a way that ensured I had the information I needed, and a nurse walked me out to my driver’s car to make sure I got there safely. The doctor/surgeon himself, Dr. Nazim II, personally called my family a few hours after the surgery to check up on me. I would also like to point out that the COVID safety procedures were excellent. The woman at the front desk wiped the form-signing tablet before anyone used it, everyone wore masks and used hand sanitizer, and they separated clean pens from pens that had been used. I wouldn’t have wanted my teeth taken out anywhere but here and I highly recommend Alabama Surgical Arts for anyone, especially people with anxiety like me.

resp.text: We are so happy to hear we could make the process as easy as possible on you. Happy holidays!

text:
I visited ASA twice. First time was a consultation with Dr. Sami Nizam and the second was to have several teeth extracted, both top wisdom teeth and a few old crowns that could not be saved. Dr. Nizam is phenomenal! The whole ASA team is amazing! I have dentophobia because of my childhood dentist and they all made me feel very relaxed and calm from the get go.
The day of my surgery, the assistants were so sweet and kind. They had plenty of COVID precautions, as well, so 2 thumbs up! I have had NO pain since my surgery. The bleeding stopped within a few hours and I was able to enjoy some soup later on. My face is a bit puffy, but not as much as I thought I'd swell. The night after my surgery, Dr. Nizam called to check in on me to make sure I was alright. I have stitches in my mouth, but they're not bothersome. He really is an amazing surgeon. Everything took less than an hour. I highly recommend going to Alabama Surgical Arts. Overall, positive experience and they helped me overcome my dentophobia. Thank you Alabama Surgical Arts and Dr. Nizam!!

resp.text: Dentophobia be gone! It was our pleasure.

Once we were actually in the room setting up for the procedure,  the doctor and his staff made sure that I was completely at ease before getting anything started.  Dr. Nizam did a fabulous job placing my IV .... quick and no pain  whatsoever! When I woke everything was explained to me that needed to be followed post surgery. The first vist I had 12 teeth removed , got home at 12p and the bleeding had stopped  by 2p and I was enjoying potato soup. I only took one pain pill as a precaution. Around 6pm Dr Sami called just as he said he would to check on me. The next visit was a year later and nothing about the service or my care changed. I was put under by Dr Sami, with ease left there with stitches in my gum; again very little discomfort my procedure started at 315p I was home by 430p and wide awake by 530p, I took 2 tylenols , had some soup, it was a good day. Dr.Sami called around 6 like clockwork to check on me. He's  really a very nice person and allows  time to ask questions and I love that and when time permits he'll engage in a bit of small talk and his mannerisms is what I find missing and what I miss a lot in some caregivers today. I'm glad he makes you feel like you matter and you're his patient and he's going to take the best care of you.  Yes, I'm a bit long winded but I just want to give Dr Sami and his team the credit they so deserved and
I woke up to a great morning. Thank you Dr.Sami and ASA ❤🌞

name: Sheila Shelley
text:
Dr. Nizam and his staff have been excellent! From the evaluation to surgery and then follow up, everyone has just been so kind.

name: Narrae Allen
text:
Husband was sent here to have all of his wisdom teeth removed at once to avoid infection. The office is very nice, VERY efficient (we were in an out within an hour), and the Dr. himself seems attentive, and even called to check in on us that evening. My problem is with the post-op info - or lack thereof - from the nurse who helped my husband to the car.

She handed me a single sheet that mostly covered medication schedules and dietary restrictions, a pack of gauze, and 4 prescriptions. I have no knowledge of how to care for oral postop things, but my mom's a nurse so i know these things can go smoothly or horribly depending on the patient's choices after surgery - behavior that is usually informed by the advise of medical staff, since the general populace is presumably ignorant (safest assumption). I asked if I needed to replace the gauze as soon as we got home, and was about to ask what all he needed to avoid doing. The nurse quickly said, cordially but also sharply such that she cut me off before i could ask, "everything you need to know is written on this sheet" and told me to call if I had questions. Well, long story short he ended up using a straw and doing a few other things I had no idea he wasn't supposed to, because i didn't //know// those were things i needed to ask about, and the sheet made no mention of any of them. I am now unsure how much of his pain is a natural consequence, and how much is our fault. So now we're keeping an eye on, questioning every symptom, which is stressful for both of us. I acknowledge our fault herein but really feel that this all could have been avoided had we been more informed  about restrictions at discharge

resp.text: I am truthfully sorry you feel you were not given explicit instructions. We try to explain every step of the procedure in detail. I personally call every patient to ask if there are any questions the night of surgery. My personal cell phone is on your post op instructions as well. If you have any questions feel free to call me 24 hours a day. I can be available tomorrow morning if you would like me to take a look. The recommended pain control strategies with maximum dosages are listed on the post op instructions sheet if needed. Hope all is well.  -Dr. Nizam

name: Shelley Hummel
text: Alabama is blessed and lucky to have this lovely couple in there state to help women and even men feel more confident in themselves, beautiful and thriving! I had the pleasure of having them as my doctor in Arkansas and I am so sad they moved but also so excited for there opportunity! Go see them, they will not disappoint!:-)

text: Very profession, clean, and knowledgeable staff. My tooth extraction and new implant went very well.

name: Nitzelle Coenen
text: Dr. Nizam and his team are amazing! For starters, their office is beautifully maintained, making you feel instantly relaxed from the time you step in the door. The front staff is always friendly and ready to help with any needs I had. Then you can proceed up the elevator to the medspa (my favorite past time lately) and it smells so nice and has the ambiance you want when you are at a spa. I’ve had several spa treatments with Lilly Nizam, Physician Assistant, and she has been nothing but professional and on top of that she does really good work. I travel a lot for work and have visited many spa’s and hands down the service they provide is by far my favorite. The results are amazing and last longer than expected with other places. I have also had a facial cosmetic surgery consultation with Dr. Nizam and he was completely thorough and listened to all of my concerns and wants. You could tell from his demeanor that he is very passionate about his work and giving you the best results possible. At the same time he is very authentic and transparent about the results you should expect while taking all safety measures in to account. Overall, Alabama Surgical Arts is the best and will always have my business, I will continue to recommend them as my top choice.

resp.text: You have summed up everything we strive to deliver. Thank you for sharing your experience!

name: douglas gimlich
text: Great outcome with my son's teeth extraction.  Staff was so caring with children, they fully prepared us for what was coming and their discharge and pain mgmt protocols were spot on!  In fact, my son experienced zero complications to include no complaints of pain.  Can't say enough good stuff about ASA.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words. We really try to do everything to minimize pain.

name: Patrick Pendergast
text:
Dr Nazim and his talented staff  took tremendous care of me -- on short notice. Following the New Year's holiday in which I had experienced intense pain and huge swelling in my jaw, Dr. Nazim worked me in early Friday morning, having never been his patient. His staff promptly x-rayed the affected area and in no time Dr Nazim was examining me and diagnosing the problem. I was scheduled for surgery that afternoon ( since I had not fasted) and before 2:00 in the afternoon,  I was on the road to recovery and relief. Dr. Nazim emphasized, as I left the office, that I could call his cell at anytime. I hesitated to bother him by phone with an issue on Saturday morning so instead chose to text him with a question. Almost immediately he  returned my text with a  phone call and we discussed the problem.

name: Kerri Krilla
text: For over 20 years I suffered from periodontal disease and was a patient of a well respected Periodontal specialist in Philadelphia. During that time, the intent was to keep my teeth and gums as healthy as possible. Regularly scheduled deep cleaning worked. However, my doctor retired and the new staff had different ideas. The regularly scheduled deep cleaning was no longer an option, and within a couple of years my teeth deteriorated to the point where it was embarrassing to even smile. The new staff recommended extractions, at first only a few teeth. Ultimately, they planned to extract all my teeth and do implants. I agreed to have the first three teeth extracted. That was the beginning of a horrible time for me. After the extractions I bled profusely and was in a lot of pain. For two weeks I continued to bleed on and off. I was frightened ,I could not eat, and I was miserable. As time passed it didn't get much better, and I was not myself, as I was normally very outgoing and talkative, but now became very uncomfortable around people. The staff then recommended extracting the rest of my teeth and doing implants. But I was afraid of what might happen after the last experience. I thought, "if I bled so profusely from 3 extractions, how would my body react to all my teeth being extracted". The thoughts going through my head were all scary and uncertain. I sought out other opinions, but did not have a good feeling with anyone. Finally, in late 2016, I met with Dr. Sam Nizam. When we met, I immediately felt the connection, and I was comfortable. Dr. Sam listened to all my concerns attentively. I knew the qualities in a doctor that I was looking for and Dr. Sam had all of them. Dr. Sam sat me down and explained step by step what he recommended and how the procedures would be done. He was so calm and confident, and did not sugar coat anything. He explained that I needed 26 extractions, and why. He explained that I needed bone grafting for the implants to take, where he would need to do the grafting, and why. He explained that I needed a sinus lift, and where and why. Also, he showed me visually on the computer and pointed out exactly where my implants would be placed, to have the best chance of success. He explained how all procedures would be done at the same time. I was still nervous about the whole process, but I had total confidence in Dr. Sam and agreed to schedule it as soon as possible. It was February, 2018. I was in surgery for 5 1/2 hours. He performed all the work that he had explained to me. I went home, knowing I was in good hands and that I was going to be fine. But I was just a little nervous, thinking I might bleed. Dr. Sam prescribed pain killers, which I took that night and went to sleep. I awoke after a peaceful night sleep. My bleeding was the size of a dime!. I had minimal pain. I stopped taking the pain killers. I went back for a follow up. Dr. Sam was pleased with the results and so was I. No pain, no bleeding, the implants (all 11 of them) all took. I now have new teeth. I can smile again. I can speak without fear and embarrassment. At my daughter's wedding I was able to proudly smile and laugh all night! Dr. Sam gave me my life back! I am myself again! Thank you!! I will always be grateful to Dr. Sam for the incredible work he did, that now gives me the chance to enjoy life as I had not been able to do for so long. If I ever have a problem, even though I now live many states away in New Jersey, I would not hesitate to make the trip. I recommend Dr. Sam highly . He has been blessed with a tremendous talent and gift to help people. I wish him all the best,and pray that his success helps thousands more like me in the future. - Linda K

name: Jennifer Holzner
text:
DO NOT GO HERE

My boyfriend had work done here upon the recommendation of my dentist (whom I love) When we arrived they seemed very confused as to which teeth they were supposed to be pulling. I asked if they should call the dentist to double check and they said no, by looking at the x-rays it was pretty common sense as to what needed to be done. The procedure was quick, but that is not saying much considering the entire office was clearly in a rush which made more sense after the receptionist informed me they were trying to leave at noon that day. I got my boyfriend home and about an hour later he went to remove his gauze and noticed they had FORGOTTEN TO REMOVE TWO OF HIS TEETH. We had to go back and thankfully we had about 20 min to spare before they closed. Not once did they say out loud they forgot anything, they just quietly whisked him back and seemed to want to keep everything hush hush (again, trying to leave early). They never even apologized to us for the MAJOR inconvenience of having to be put out again, to have another surgery after the one he had an hour ago.

After 2 months of waiting, any time I called to inquire about our bill or to get a break down everyone was extremely rude. Transferring me without stating what they were doing, getting an attitude over the phone. Not to mention I never once EVER got a call back from a voicemail I left, I always had to call back the next morning.

Anyways, this place sucks. They seem fancy and like a well oiled machine but you are not their priority, believe me. Full of crotchety old ladies who pass the buck.

After hanging up with her, I called back a few hours later to inquire about potentially being seen earlier as I was in some pain, and she stated they could see me tomorrow at 9:15am. I said I’ll take it with no hesitation. When I arrived to complete paperwork and the assistant (Toya) was AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!! Dr. Miller was always great, and the phone call this evening to check in on me was great, as she wanted to see how I was doing, and I was able to ask her a few questions. name: Donald Tyler
text: I had an awesome visit! Dr.Miller and her staff were amazing! I needed a wisdom tooth pulled and they extracted it with no pain whatsoever! I would go back and I would definitely recommend them!

name: Emma F
text: Dr. Miller and her practice are outstanding. I went in to have all four wisdom teeth extracted. I had extremely high anxiety about getting anesthesia, and the whole process, but Dr. Miller and her kind assistant April took their time in making sure I was comforted and at ease. They addressed all my concerns in a very professional caring way and I couldn’t have asked for a better experience.

name: Tams Bunn
text:
Dr Miller, as kind and bubbly as you are, you permanently ruined my jaw during a routine filling replacement a few years ago.
My regular dentist had an emergency so this was my first and only experience to get to meet you. You seemed young and cool and when the dental assistant suggested using a bite block/dental dam (padding) to help rest my jaw, you told he you didn't usually use those and didn't need it. (No one asked the patient)
After FIVE needle sticks to the area, one of the injections hitting a nerve that sent an electrical shock through my head and neck... I was getting a little nervous. But I told myself, simple replacing an old filling, she seems nice.
During the procedure, the dental assistant repeatedly suggested you use a bite block or wedge to help keep my mouth open so there wouldn't be a need to push my jaw down so far.
I couldn't Feel anything after the 5 shots, but as you pushed down on my jaw to drill, I heard my jaw make a loud POP Twice through my head and it made me shutter.
Since I couldn't Feel anything I didn't know how severe the damage was, just knew I could no longer open my mouth at all the next day. Called the office and was told it might be sore for a couple of days.
I could barely get a straw in my mouth for days, finally had x-rays by an oral surgeon and was told the ligaments were completely torn loose and I would NEVER open my mouth again without surgical repair of Both jaws.
That was just the beginning of a long painful process to then recover from an oral surgery that never needed to happen if the filling were done with more care and awareness. After the jaw surgery, i spent 3 Months off work in constant pain, 6 more months trying to work in constant pain. For over 9 months, there was not one day that I didn't sit and Cry in pain and frustration. Over 9 months i could eat nothing but pudding, jello, mashed potatoes and applesauce. It took Over 2 long years of intense physical therapy to open my mouth to just a few millimeters.
It changed the course of rest of my life in many ways.
I had planned to get invisible braces after that filling replacement, but couldnt open my mouth enough to have any further dental work done for over 3 years.
My mouth suffered, even my voice - I can't speak as loudly as I used to, everyone says I sound like I'm mumbling now.
That horrible life changing day was about 10 years ago and I've had to get used to a different life.
I got NOTHING for all my pain and suffering, not even an apology from you personally.
The next time I asked to speak to you they said you were just helping out and were no longer with their practice.
NOW I have huge bone masses growing above my gum line due to clenching from the jaw pain, and am told I need to have extra bone growth surgically removed.
Can you believe my current dental office just referred me to YOU for the surgery for oral surgery?
Shes young and had no idea, but she does now! Not only has this been costly to me physically, emotionally, financially, but it also affected my career in the long run and its still causing more medical problems to require additional surgeries.
One dental visit with a young upcoming dentist to replace a filling, changed my life forever, put me through an unexpected nightmare, and I'm still paying for it.
I'm beyond disappointed, I'm completely devastated.

resp.text:
Tams Bunn-
We are sorry to hear about your experience having a filling placed.  Our practice is limited to oral surgery and we do not do fillings.  Dr. Miller has never practiced general dentistry and has never placed any fillings in a dental practice.   Possibly it was another Dr. Miller.  We hope you are able to find a   solution to your problem.

name: Kelly Rolen
text:
Dr. Miller was highly recommended by my dentist and I see why my dentist has such a high opinion of Lisa Miller Oral Facial Surgery.

I found the staff extremely friendly and upbeat during each visit.

All of my appointments were scheduled promptly and minimal wait times were experienced.  Essentially, if I had a 2:30 PM appointment, I was walked through the door, to a patient room at 2:30 PM.  Rescheduling appointments were simple and did not require me to pay some crazy fee for rescheduling.

The quoted price was exactly what I paid for the installation of a dental implant, to which the procedure and subsequent visits went very well, meaning no discomfort or pain.

I found Dr. Miller's bed side manner to be extremely professional and educating as she answered every question I had regarding the procedure, hardware, time duration, etc..

In summary, I highly recommend Lisa Miller Oral Facial Surgery and commend the entire staff regarding their professionalism, friendliness and overall presentation.

I had plenty of time to ask questions.  The extraction went well.  I was sent home with good directions. My post-operative time has been with some minimal discomfort but no pain - handled with only over-the-counter medications.  Of note, the entire staff was excellent.  Almost all of the pre-appointment information was done online with a follow up phone call. That was so much better than filling out papers in the waiting room.  I will definitely recommend Dr. Lisa Miller to others in need of oral surgery.

name: Sarah Miller
text: The office manager was very helpful and the staff was very nice and friendly. Had an overall excellent experience.

name: Mackenzie Massey
text: Awesome staff and physician!

name: Margaret Davidson
text: experience was quick and easy! would definitely recommend for wisdom teeth removal

name: Doug Hartman
text: made appointment and they said I needed to wait 4 weeks to see Dr, even though I told them I have my jaw bone protruding into my mouth and in a great deal of pain. Then they call a week before appointment and need to see me earlier in the day. Then I get another call and am told that the Dr does not do do surgery on jaw bones and she cant help me. Tells me to go to UAB. Thanks for making me wait 3 weeks in pain, now I get to wait again!

name: Brian Hinson
text: Great team! Happy to recommend them!

name: Evie Morris
text: Great experience!

name: Hope McDuffie
text: Wonderful experience at Dr. Millers office!

name: Carolyn Haynes
text: I went to Cumberland back in 2015 to get fillings and a root canal done. Long story short, I have paid three times to get the same filling re-done and now my crown has came out which will result in me paying more money at another dentist office. I agree with others, they seem very rushed at everything they do, but I can’t afford for them to keep messing up costing me money. Never again will I go back, good luck to those who do and kudos to those who have had a better experience.

name: Flenardo Taylor
text: If they would take pride in their customers like their Christmas decoration. People will love them.  I read the reviews and I have to agree. The front staff wasn't so friendly. Only came for an exam. The dentist was cool.

name: Stephen McGatha
text: Been going for over a year now. They seem to genuinely offer good dental services. Fairly good at keeping dental appointments.

name: April Jordan
text: The worst place I've ever been.. Went to get 3 fillings put in and I was in so much pain for several days. The dentist never said a word to me when I went to get the fillings not even hello... I do not recommend this place to anyone. When I went back due to so much pain I found out he put the filling in too deep and hit a nerve now I have to get the tooth pulled or a root canal... SMH.. The worst place

name: Melissa Simmons
text: I went in last Saturday to get 4 wisdom tooth removed when I got back in the room for them to proceed to do the procedure I feel it was a rush job and they was just ready to go home dr. Kelly had no bedside manners in my opinion she was just ready to clock out to me I feel as if she was trying to talk me out of it after I paid cash money with no insurance to get it done after about four to five days at home I noticed the back of my teeth had a funny taste with something coming out of them I put a napkin in my mouth to find that it was yellow stuff coming out of it I immediately called the office on a Saturday during business hours no one ever picked up the phone after I got off work I proceeded to call back that night in the answering service picked up and I told her that someone needed to get in contact with me because it was an emergency and what the situation was this was Sunday it is now 4:10 p.m. Monday and no one has still contacted me I went to the emergency room on Sunday night and they told me the antibiotic that I got with the procedure that I had I should not have that antibiotic they put me on more antibiotics of which I had to pay for my ER visit but long story short I wouldn't recommend taking a dog to this place with no one contact you about an emergency that is a red flag!!!!!

name: Robert Caldwell
text: Very friendly staff,. professional I will recommend to others.

name: S
text: Do not go to them, they only care for money and the whole staff is snooty. Have never been to such a rude, snobby, uncaring set of people.

name: Synthia Johnson
text: Horrible...Terrible Dr's Bedside mannerisms...Won't go bck here......................

name: Thomas Dorer
text: I have been a patient of Dr. Dillard’s for over 20 years. He takes time to explain what needs to be addressed. The staff are friendly and engaging. I love the office. Like all dentists  though he still asked questions with his hands in my mouth.

name: Rachel Swain
text: There is NO better dentist, nor dentist staff, that is better than Dr. Dillard and his staff!! Like most, I’ve never been one to ‘get excited’ about the dentist, but now I am LEGITIMATELY excited and looking forward to seeing the staff and Dr. Dillard. They are so down to earth and personable, and there is no other dentist I’ll EVER visit in the greater Birmingham area :-)

name: Vicki Boswell
text:
I’m a new patient to Dr. Dillard, but feel like I have been coming here a long time.  Dr. Dillard and his entire staff make you feel at home and always make sure you are “ok”.  They are all very kind and make the entire experience enjoyable.  They are a faith based practice and their light always shines bright.

I have been to a lot of dentists in my lifetime and they are at the top of my list !!!

I highly recommend them !

name: Wendal Burks
text: I enjoy talking with Mrs Ryan just in the two visits I had at the office it seems as if we have known each other longer. She is very good dental hygienist. I trust that they know what is best for my dental needs

name: Tim Scott
text: Our family has been long term patients of Dr. Dillard and we can't say enough good things about the entire staff!  They're always up to date on new techniques and are very careful to make your visit as pain free as possible.  We wouldn't go anywhere else and we highly recommend Dr. Dillard!

name: Megan Scarborough
text:
Lisa Tucker is the most amazing person in the world! I could not imagine going to a dentist that did not employ someone like Lisa.

Also, everyone there is amazing too. They make you feel like you're at home which is hard to do at a dentist's office. I have recommended them multiple times and will continue to do so.

name: Kourtney Robinson
text: Great experience! More than patient and gentle with my sensitive teeth, always kind and trying to make sure i’m comfortable.

name: Brandi Newman
text:
From start to finish this dental office was top notch!  The front staff had smiles on their faces when you walk in.  Then your hygienist comes out to greet you, mine being Shelley.  She sits down in front of you making you feel like you were her family and I love that because it makes you feel as though they truly do care!  Then of course on to the next part of the dentist, WHICH I HATE” Shelley made very pleasant!
After all that the bad news😩!  I have MS so my teeth have a lot of issues and Dr. Dillard was so caring and very sweet and was going to work on a plan to help my teeth!  Great experience 💙😊😊😊

name: TwoSeater Reaper
text: Awesome staff, and they are professional! Super nice and everyone greets you with a smile! Wouldn't go anywhere else in Bham area for any kind of dental work!!

name: Samantha Peppers
text:
Love the people here! Always kind and professional
I am an actual patient here, not just some troll that gives bad reviews because I don’t like their political sign in the yard! 🙄 I guess I care more about having nice teeth than who Dr. Dillard votes for! And I do have nice teeth, because Shelly takes great care of me!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your courage and honesty

name: Chirihane Ouaoua
text: Love seeing Dr Dillard and his staff. Tina cleans ny teeth very well. Dr Dillard does a phenomenal job about keeping my teeth healthy. Each time I go they have some kind of technology improvement with the tools they're using for patients, which means they're on top of their game in the dentistry field.

name: Clayton Peppers
text: A friend recommended Dr Dillard to me a few years ago and he, and his top-notch dental team, have been my go-to ever since.  They handle all of my dental work with a warm attitudes and a friendly atmosphere.  If you don’t have a regular dentist, or you’re looking for a new one, give them a try - you’ll be happy you did......and if not, at least your teeth be really clean.

name: Vada Lasa
text: Dr. Keith is very good at what he does, my teeth haven’t been cleaned as well as he cleans.

name: Megan Patterson
text: Dr Dillard and his team have always provided the BEST in dental care. Tina and Shelly are amazing! Well, they are all amazing! From the front desk ladies to the techs that jump in to help out when needed, they really know how to work as a team. They are honest, caring, and always ask about concerns I may have. Always on the forefront of best practice, Dr Dillard is a wealth of knowledge! If I could give 10 stars I would! Love this place!

name: Roshinau Houston
text: Professional, close to home, love everyone's vibe and energy, super friendly and fun atmosphere.

text: I love Dr Dillard and everyone that works there is the best. Shelley has been cleaning my teeth for 20 yrs were else are you going to find that. Dr Dillard is the best at what he does. If your teeth mean something to you than this is the place for you.

text: Dr. Keith Dillard is the BEST dentist ever!!! He has an amazing staff who work together so well and who truly care about their patients. Their knowledge is superb along with state-of-the-art equipment/technology. They take incredible measures to ensure your comfort!

Epitome of professionalisam!!!

text: I always look forward to my visits at Dr Dillard's office! His entire staff is very cheerful and welcoming. I recently moved to Alabama and needed to find a new dentist. He is very gentle and meticulous with all his procedures. Just stop in and see all the great before and after photos he has in office, you'll leave feeling better than when you came in!

resp.text: Thanks Naomi! We always love seeing you.  We especially enjoy our tooth cacti, all of our patients love them!

text:
Going to the Dentist is like going to see your family every 6 months. They make you feel like you’re part of their family. We love Doctor Dillard and his staff.

Every time my kids take pictures I get comments about how pretty their teeth looks.  Thank you Dr Dillard for a great experience for me and my family.

name: Anna Sparks
text: I love my dentist and his staff. It’s a clean, friendly environment and they are some of the best at what they do. I will not go anywhere else.

name: Michael Glaze
text: We love Dr. Dillard and his entire staff! This is an amazing group of christian people and they provide wonderful care. My family has been coming to Dr. Dillard for over sixteen years. We aren't going anywhere else.

name: Peggy Strauss
text:
Dr. Dillard and his staff are very professional, kind, do excellent work, and will go over and beyond the call of duty to be there when you need them. I had a dental emergency when out of town, called them for advice, they gave me the name and number of a dentist out of town to help me temporarily, then, met me at their clinic as soon as I returned to Birmingham to repair my tooth permanently.
Another time when I had a dental emergency, Dr. Dillard was out of town. What did he do? He actually came back from his trip early to meet me at his clinic after hours on a day they were closed!  He brought his wife to be his dental assistant and he repaired my tooth in order for me not to miss work the next morning!  What else can I say about this awesome doctor and his amazing staff!?! They are the best! I highly recommend them!!!

resp.text: THANK YOU!

text: He is the best dentist I have ever gone to.  My son & his wife also use him and speak very highly of him. If you want a great dentist Dr. Dillard is it. Fred Cross
